title: W.S. UNITED'S / CHAMPION SYSTEM SPRING SERIES
CRCA Grant's Tomb Criterium
description: CRCA Grant's Tomb Criterium
course: We will be running two courses throughout the day: a short and a long course
registration: All registration done via Bikereg.  Opens February 1st.
notes:
A lot of work has gone into hosting a race at the Grant’s Tomb site and we hope to continue the tradition this race. In order to do so we emphasize that all race participants and spectators must be be respectful of visitors to Grant’s Tomb National Memorial, Riverside Church, Riverside Park, and Sakura Park throughout the day.
● Do not interfere with the activities of users of these facilities and be respectful of, and cooperate fully with, any directions from law enforcement officers and race staff.
● Cyclists are NOT ALLOWED to use the restrooms or otherwise enter Riverside Church. T here will be port-o-johns available on-site at the North and South ends of the race course on southbound Riverside Drive.
● Cyclists are NOT ALLOWED to use Grant’s Tomb National Memorial as a changing area. DO NOT enter the memorial during the race.
● Please utilize garbage bags and garbage cans, or take your garbage with you. D o not litter.
● No day-of registration for the race. All registration must be completed in advance on B ikereg. If
you have questions about registration please contact b ikereg@crca.net. 
● Results will be published shortly following the conclusion of each race and riders will have a 15
minute protest period. After the protest period, results are final.
● Neutral support will be provided by SRAM. Officials will provide information on free laps prior to the start. Familiarize yourself with USAC rule 3D4 regarding free laps.
● Due to the course distance, it is possible that a break could lap the field. Please be aware of the lead moto if a break laps the field and familiarize yourself with corresponding USAC rules 3D3 and 3D4.
● Officials will give instructions regarding pulled riders during staging. Given the distance of the course, riders are likely to get pulled, so please listen and look out for instructions.
● Officials will time the opening laps of each field and provide a lap count based on those times. The lap counter is located at the finish line.
● Numbers must be pinned on the Right side and back.
directions: Grants Tomb Memorial.  W 122nd St. & Riverside Dr.

address.street: Booth Memorial Avenue and Parsons Avenue

title: UNITED'S RUBAIX RACE SERIES p/b CHAMPION SYSTEM
Castelli New York City Cycling Series
CRCA Men's and Women's Race Clinic
description: Each year as part of CRCA’s coaching and development program the club hosts a Men’s Clinic and a Women’s Clinic designed to introduce individuals to the club and bicycle racing.  Many of the City’s elite racers have been introduced to the sport through our intro to racing clinics, including current pro cyclist and national time trial champion Evelyn Stevens.  For more on Evelyn’s story see this Bicycling article.
course: Central Park
registration: All registration done via BikeReg
notes:
Nervous? On the fence?  Attend a Clinic Information session to meet members of the CRCA who will tell you how they got started racing and answer any questions you may have about the clinic, CRCA or racing in general. This is also a great way to meet fellow new racers whom you’ll see on race day! All are welcome even if you don’t end up attending the actual clinic.
Information Session (Open to all)
directions: Rambles Shed Parking Lot.  (E79th St Transverse on East Park Drive) Central Park

title: Check Your Legs Road Race
description: 12.5 Mile Loop with two challenging 1/2 mile climbs.     Classic road course with climbing, descending and flats !  Racers will do 2 to 4 laps.
course: 12.5 Mile Loop with two challenging 1/2 mile climbs.    Gearing suggestions of 39 x 25.
registration: Entry will be on Bikereg only.  No day of entries.
notes: Race will be held rain or shine....but not in snow...sleet or icy conditions.    Please note...THAT ONCE YOU REGISTER ONLINE NEITHER BIKEREG OR CNYC WILL REFUND YOUR ENTRY FEE.  All proceeds will go to the local Fire and EMS Squads in Garrattsville NY.     Race Starts at  908 Co. Hwy 16 in Garrattsville, NY.   Race will finish at roughly the top of the first major climb on the course.    One Day License will be available at the race for $10.  All Citizen Racers wishing to participate must either buy a One Day License or USA Cycling Annual license.   Please contact Peter at petercnyc@gmail.com for information.  Or 607-437-2545.
directions: Race start is at the New Lisbon Town Hall.   It's address is 908 Co. Hwy 16 in Garrattsville, NY.   From the South take Route 51 into Garrattsville and turn right.  From the North take Route 51 into Garrattsville and head straight.

title: I WILL FOUNDATION Tuesday Night Race Series
The Women's Woodstock Cycling Grand Prix
Bear Mountain Spring Classic
description: 2016 CRCA Bear Mountain Classic
course: This course is open to traffic and utilizes a rolling enclosure. USAC 3B1 “center line rule” is in effect for the entire race course except for the final 500M of the finish lap only, and will be STRICTLY ENFORCED. Deliberate riding on the left side of the centerline in order to advance position or repeated drifting to the left of the centerline without provocation will result in a penalty, including disqualification from the Race. Additionally, riders may also be relegated or disqualified at the discretion of the Chief Referee. The centerline rule is in effect for all Sprints and K/QOM sprints. Racers may use the entire roadway only for the final 500M of the race (finish lap only).
registration: All registration done through bikereg.com   NO DAY OF REGISTRATION
notes:
● Junior Rollout: Per USAC rule 1I4, ALL Juniors (no matter what category they are competing in) must report to rollout IMMEDIATELY after finishing. Rollout will take place just after the finish. Look for signs. Penalties for failing to report to rollout or if bike fails rollout: loss of any sprint or K/QOM placings and possible relegation of finishing place at the discretion of the Chief Referee and Race Director.
● Littering: Please utilize garbage bags and garbage cans, or take your garbage with you. D o not litter. Participants who discard bottles or wrappers in unapproved areas will be subject to a $30 fine per the USAC Discipline Table 8A4(a) or disqualification from the race at the discretion of the Chief Referee and Race Director. The only approved area for discarding litter on the race course is at the feed zone. Under New York State law, littering is subject to prosecution including a fine. T he fine is stiff! Please be self-policing, and the race will have monitors.
● Food: Food will be available for purchase from vendors at the Lake Welch Parking lot.
www.CRCA.net | w ww.facebook.com/crca .net 5
● Bathrooms:
Park facilities will be open for our use the day of the race. Please make use of these restrooms. Urinating and/or defecating on parks property will not be tolerated and you will be subject to New York State laws including a fine and disqualification from the race. Please see the Race Village Map for restroom location - Please use the Beach Side Restrooms.
directions:
The race is located at Lake Welch Beach in Harriman State park:  Please note that there is only ONE road that enters Harriman state park that does not interrupt the race course. Most roads into the park will either put you on the race.
From North and East: Palisades Parkway to Exit 15 -> Gate Hill Road
From South: Palisades Parkway to Exit 14 -> Willow Grove Road -> Gate Hill Road
From West: I-87 S -> Exit 15A to RT 17 to NY-59 E -> US-202 E -> Laddentown Rd -> Call Hollow Rd -> Willow Grove Rd -> Gate Hill Rd
Please only approach the park from the South East via Gate Hill Road.
The following roads will put you on the race course, avoid them if possible: Seven Lakes Drive, Lake Welch Parkway, RT 106.
DO NOT take Exit 16 from the Palisades Parkway - This will put you directly on the race course!

The Lake Welch Beach parking is available for parking. There is a separate road to the parking lot, please make use of this. Do not drive on Lake Welch Parkway. The lot is large and has ample space for everyone.
DO NOT PARK ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD ANYWHERE IN PARK.  The Lake Welch Beach parking is available for parking. There is a separate road to the parking lot, please make use of this. Do not drive on Lake Welch Parkway. The lot is large and has ample space for everyone.

Staging will be 15 minutes before your race. Please see the Race Village Map for staging locations. Signs will be posted.

title: CRCA Dave Jordan Central Park Classic
description: Dave Jordan Central Park Classic
course:
IMPORTANT NOTES

Central Park: 
Please be respectful of Central Park and other park users before, during and after the race. Do not litter in the Park. Use labeled trash receptacles.
The safety of our racers and other Park users is paramount: 
Do not ride on Park paths
Do not ride against the flow of traffic - this includes pre- and post-race!
Do not ride in the recreation/joggers’ lane in Central Park. THIS LANE IS STRICTLY FORBIDDEN.

Rider Conduct:
Unless specific exceptions are noted in this Technical Guide, this race is governed by the rules found in the 2015 USA Cycling Rulebook. See www.usacycling.org. The Chief Referee may increase/extend any fines or impose other penalties according to the gravity of the offense. Relegations affect placings. Monetary fines issued to riders or teams are to be paid directly to USA Cycling per USAC rule 1K2d. 

Helmets:
Per USAC rule 1J1, riders are required to wear a securely fastened helmet at all times while mounted on a bicycle (does not apply to riding rollers/trainers during warm-up). This rule is in effect at all times for all competitors from the opening of registration through the final awarding of prizes.

Junior Rollout:
Per USAC rule 1I4, ALL Juniors (no matter what category they are competing in) must report to
rollout IMMEDIATELY after finishing. Rollout will take place in the registration area. Penalties for failing to report to rollout or if bike fails rollout is possible relegation of finishing place at the discretion of the Chief Referee and Race Director.

Bathrooms:
While we make every effort to have the Parks Department open the restrooms prior to the start of racing, we cannot guarantee their availability in the morning - please plan accordingly. Urinating and/or defecating on parks property will not be tolerated and you will be subject to New York State laws including a fine, disqualification from the race, and a ban from participation in future CRCA events.

Results:
Top 10 results will be posted near registration shortly after the finish of your race. After results have been posted, racers will have a 15 minute protest period. After the 15 minute protest period, results will be final. Full results will be posted to USAC. 

It is the racers’ responsibility to verify their result during this 15 minute protest period.  Results will not be changed afterwards.



Numbers: 
Racers will be provided with two numbers.  Numbers must be pinned on the RIGHT and BACK of the riders jersey over pockets.  Incorrect placement of numbers may lead to incorrect results.
registration: All registration is done via Bikereg.
notes:
COURSE NOTES

DO NOT ENTER THE REC LANE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE. For safety reasons the rec lane is strictly off limits and infractions are subject to automatic disqualification and for CRCA members, suspension from the Club.
directions: Rambles Shed parking lot (E79th st Transverse and Park Drive East). Central Park, NYC

title: CRCA Hincapie Classic in memory of Lou Maltese Memorial
description: The Century Road Club Association and Hincapie Sportsware Corp. are excited to bring the CRCA Hincapie Classic in Memory of Lou Maltese back to central park.  This race is the first race of the CRCA Hincapie Omnium, the second and final race of said Omnium is the CRCA Hincapie Grand Prix in Honor of Fred Mengoni on July 17, 2016.
course: The start is from the top of Cat's Paw hill near Rambles Shed.  The finish line will be clearly marked on the day of the race near Tavern on the Green.
registration:
There is no day of registration for this race. All registration must be completed in advance at https://www.bikereg.com/lou-maltese-memorial and https://www.bikereg.com/lou-maltese-memorial-123-team-invitational (team invitational).

Waitlists are NOT offered. 

If you have questions about registration please contact bikereg@crca.net
notes: DO NOT ENTER THE REC LANE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE. For safety reasons the rec lane is strictly off limits and infractions are subject to automatic disqualification and for CRCA members, suspension from the Club.
directions:
Racer check-in is located at the Rambles Parking lot at the top of the Still Hunt Hill (Cat’s Paw) – East Drive at approximately 79th Street. Riders can access the park via Fifth Avenue and 72nd Street.
					
See the Central Park Map: http://www.centralpark.com/maps/group/maps and Choose “Still Hunt” from the drop down menu.
					 							
Check-in will open at ~4:40AM and will close at 5:20AM.

Any confirmed riders who have not signed in by 5:20AM will not be allowed to race.

Do not place your bike on the grass. Use the provided bike racks. 

Do not ride down the paths toward registration, or on paths to the bathrooms. DISMOUNT and walk!

title: Farm to Fork Fondo - Hudson Valley
description:
Escape to rows of rich black fields standing guard like soldiers against the pressure of the world's most iconic urban landscape. Breathe deeply as you pedal through the beautiful rural region that has been supplying food to the masses for centuries

One of "10 Must-Ride US Gran Fondos in 2016" - Gran Fondo Guide

In New York's lower Hudson Valley, dairy farms, orchards, vegetable growers and vineyards characterize the region's agricultural horn of plenty. The area is filled with families that have dedicated their lives to farming, from eighth generation stalwarts to newcomers drawn to the regions's climate, soil and access to metropolitan markets.

Get ready for a weekend filled with culinary delights made from ingredients sourced from the beautiful farms along your route. Pennings Farm head chef Oscar Elias and executive chef Heather Kurosz are an experienced farm-to-table specialist team who will be whipping up feasts worthy of kings and hoards of hungry foodie cyclists.

Join 500 lucky cyclists for a mass-start, fully-supported gran fondo led by the Colavita | Bianchi Professional Cycling Team. Work up your appetite over a challenging course through the 'Black Dirt' farmland with Ride With GPS timed segments, magnificent views, and farm stop aid stations featuring locally-sourced treats. 

Wrenegade Sports gran fondos are rides, not races, and have distance options for all abilities.
course:
TEAM COLAVITA 
BIANCHI GRAN FONDO
87 MILES

Nearly 6,000 feet of climbing. Dozens of Orange County farms. Passage through the heart of the black dirt muck soil. Breathtaking views and punishing ascents. Earn your feast. Dine in style.

MEDIO FONDO
54 MILES

Get up close and personal with Hudson Valley agriculture and the black dirt. Challenge yourself on some climbs and take in the views. All of the Gran Fondo experience in a tighter package.

PICCOLO FONDO
36 MILES

Rolling hills, working farms and bucolic vistas of the Hudson Valley's distinctive farmland. Your favorite Sunday drive, now on two wheels. We've packed the picnic.

RAMBLE RIDE
12 MILES

See some farms and lovely views by bike. Wave to your friends. Cross the finish line. Relax and dine. Happy tummies ride local.
registration:
https://endurancecui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=27880753

ALL FONDO ENTRANTS WILL RECEIVE:

Celebratory mass start led by the Colavita | Bianchi Professional Cycling Team
Deluxe aid stations at working farms with treats from the farm
Ride With GPS timed segments*
A beautiful, well-marked, and well-supported ride with police support, marshals and signage
Sag (rescue) vehicles to help you back to the start if the day doesn't go according to plan
Ticket to the post-ride Farm to Fork Barbecue
1 free post-ride hard cider from the Pennings Farm Cidery (21 & over)
Access to the pre-ride Colavita Italian Coffee Station
Stylish 100% cotton Farm to Fork Fondo t-shirt*
Customized Farm to Fork Fondo souvenir number plate by Bianchi
Commemorative finisher's prize
Farm to Fork Fondo welcome bag featuring cycling swag, and local Hudson Valley goodies
Raffle tickets for tons of awesome prizes including two Bianchi bikes
Free parking at Pennings Farm
Special lodging rates at area hotels
Some pretty fantastic memories and more

title: USAC Regional Talent ID Road Camp (Finger Lake)
The Rock Criterium
description:
Under the title sponsorship of American Rock Salt, The Rock Criterium and Gran Fondo is a two-day bicycling celebration that provides a unique format of racing and riding. This year's event will couple race categories for riders of all abilities and ages on Saturday with a scenic, professionally supported timed ride and party for recreational riders of all abilities and ages on Sunday.

The criterium races will then begin in the morning on an exciting 6-turn course that features left and right corners, two short up and down hill sections and one fast s-curve all on a .9-mile loop. Not only can racers expect a great course but there will be cash payouts to upper categories including $1,500 in the Men's Pro 1/2/3.
course: The course features 6 turns with both right and left corners as well as two short climbs all on a .9 mile loop through historic Mount Morris, NY.
registration: www. bikereg.com
notes:
Want to race twice? Second crit race is just $10. 
We will provide free entries to all current NYS Champions. Contact promoter for free entry code.
All riders must wear a helmet at all times both while warming up and during competition. No exceptions. If you're riding without a helmet you will be disqualified without a refund. 
Day-of registration for crit races closes 30 minutes before each race. 
Podium presentations for crit field immediately follows 15-minute protest period at start/finish line.
First 150 riders receive free event socks
Race day mechanical support provided by Bike Loft East Neutral Support
directions: From I 390 head East on Route 408 into the village of Mount Morris. The course start and finish will be on Chapel Street and will be closed to traffic. Racers can park in municipal lot on Main Street, at Bellamy Park on Lackawanna Ave or on public parking on Main Street.

Riders can access the park via Fifth Avenue and 72nd Street.See the Central Park Map: http://www.centralpark.com/maps/group/maps and Choose “Still Hunt” from the drop down menu.

title: The Rock Gran Fondo
description:
With course options that will accommodate and challenge both beginners and expert cyclists alike this new event is sure to be a hit. The longest course, our Gran Fondo, is only for our most experienced riders. With more than 100 miles and more than 8,000 feet of climbing, this ride will challenge even the best climbers while showcasing some of the most beautiful roads in Livingston and Allegany counties. 

For our intermediate and beginner riders we have challenges of 60 (Medio Fondo) and 30 (Piccolo Fondo) miles that also feature beautiful roads, supported rest stops and excellent challenges for all cyclists.

Additionally, fondo riders of all three distances receive a post ride meal, finishers medal, t-shirt, professionally timed results, professional mechanical support, and on course rest stops as part of the entry fee as well as the chance to win great door prizes.

Thanks to the support of the Village of Mount Morris, the event will be held in the middle of village and offers lots to do before and after your races.
course: The event offers three course of the following distances: 103 miles, 56 miles, 30 miles, and an 8 mile Greenway Family Fun ride. All three courses are challenging but the 103 mile Gran Fondo course is VERY difficult with more than 8,000 feet of climbing.
registration: www.bikereg.com
notes:
The Gran Fondo distance (the 103 mile course) is for experts ONLY and will have cut off times installed on course. This course is VERY challenging. Even riders who have ridden century rides in the past may have trouble due to extreme elevation. If you're not familiar with what "8000 ft" means, this distance is probably not for you. 
The 6 a.m. early wave is for Gran Fondo riders who anticipate a finish time of 7.5 hours or more. The late time if for riders who anticipate a time of less than 7.5 hours. These waves are meant to bring riders back to the finish about the same time and to accommodate our meal time of 1-4 pm. We will not require riders to enter one field or another, but please note that entering the wrong field may mean you are back too early or too late for the meal window.
All fondo distances are timed but NONE are races. All riders MUST follow the "rules of the road." All roads are open to traffic. Any rider who breaks the "rules of the road" will be disqualified and banned from future events. If you have questions, please contact promoter.
All riders must have a helmet at all times.
All riders must sign a waiver.
All riders receive a free post-ride dinner
All riders who register prior to July 1 first will receive a free event tee-shirt. 
All turns are marked with signs but not marshaled. It is up to the rider to follow the signs and pay attention to the course markings and/or carry a course map that will be provided at registration and by email before the event.
Race day mechanical support provided by Bike Loft East Neutral Support
directions: From I390 go east on Route 408 into the Village or Mount Morris. Turn right on to Mill Street and right on to Lackawanna Ave. Parking in Bellamy Park.

title: New York State Time Trial Championships- 2016
2016 New York and New Jersey State Track Championships
2016 Point to Pint Ride
description:
The Point to Pint Ride is for cyclists who enjoy great beer, phenomenal scenery, the company of fellow riders and the opportunity to push themselves on a 100-mile, 50-mile, or 15-mile challenging course. Post ride party at Empire Farmstead Brewery features award winning craft beer and amazing locally sourced food. 

Full pint or 100-mile riders start their day at 9:00am with a pre-ride breakfast at Empire Farmstead Brewery in Cazenovia, NY. Ride check in begins at 8:00am.

Half Pint or 50-mile riders head out at 12:00pm, arriving back in time to enjoy the post ride party with our Full Pint participants. Ride check in begins at 11:00am

The Sampler! A 15-mile "taste" of our local roadways. Your day begins at 2:00pm and brings you back in time for the post ride party at Empire Farmstead Brewery! Ride check in begins at 1:00pm
course:
The Point to Pint Ride Full Pint- 100 miles with just about 6000 feet of ascent for the hill loving cyclist. You'll wind your way out to Hamilton, Oriskany Falls and up through the windmills of Fenner before returning to Empire Farmstead Brewery in time to brag over a fine, hand-crafted ale at the post-ride party. This ride costs $85 and departs at 9am. View the course here - www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/1213756255


•The Point to Pint Ride Half Pint- 50 miles through some of the prettiest rolling countryside and picturesque lakes Madison County has to offer. With a total ascent just over 3000 feet, this ride makes you earn your post ride beers at Empire Farmstead Brewery, but won't leave you too tired to enjoy them! This ride costs $65 and departs at 12pm. View the course here - http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/1213716916


•The Point to Pint Ride Sampler- 16 miles and change with a total ascent of about 550 feet! This course for the guys and gals who love beer way more than riding their bike. Beginner and family friendly. Intersections will have course marshals to help you find your way back to Empire Farmstead Brewery in time for the post-ride party at 3pm! This ride costs $40 and departs at 2pm. View course map here - http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/1213701595
registration: http://www.active.com/cazenovia-ny/cycling/races/point-to-pint-ride-2016-25240157
directions: Ride starts and ends at Empire Farmstead Brewery located at 33 Rippleton Road, Cazenovia NY, 13035.

title: Syracuse Bicycle Cyclocross Festival at redbarn20
Knox Farm Cyclocross
description: The Knox Farm Cyclocross race was started in 2014 to honor the memory of Jason Kempsten, a local racer that became the first NYS park ranger at the Knox Farm. For 2016, the race will honor the memory of Frank Mesi, Jr., founder and creator of the Knox Farm Cyclocross race. Frank was a lifelong supporter of racing in WNY and delighted in bringing cyclocross racing to the Knox Farm in East Aurora.
course: New course for 2016 features a different start and finish with a longer section in the woods. The Knox Farm has gently rolling terrain with a road section. Expect hot, dry and firm ground conditions.
registration: All racers must pre-register on-line only at USAcycling.org; no race day sign-up will be available. Canadian racers with a UCI license can create a free account on USAcycling.
notes: The Knox Farm State Park requests all racers use the second and separate parking lot. The first gravel lot is reserved for park patrons. There are indoor bathrooms on the property.
directions: Please use the Knox Farm entrance at 437 Buffalo St in East Aurora.

title: Muddy Tire
description: Awesome combination…Schiff Scout Trail system meets DEC Calverton Trail System.
course:
The Short course, for Beginners/Cat 3, is 13 miles (1 loop).

The Long course, Cat 1, Cat 2, Fat Tire and Single Speed is 26 miles (2 loops).
Both courses’ terrain is varied. Tight single-track with challenging climbs, fast double track for
passing and spectacular Deep Pond scenery

****The Schiff Scout Reservation is a PRIVATE Boy Scout Camp and is NOT open to the general public. No trespassing is allowed. Please do not attempt to preview this course****
registration:
Adult Reg fees:-
Until 6/15 = $65
6/16 - 7/15 = $70
7/16 - 9/1 = $75
Day of Race = $85
notes:
USA Cycling
Membership
This race is sanctioned by USA Cycling.  You must be a valid member to participate in this event. It's not as hard as it sounds; you can actually become a member either for a year or one day during the registration process (additional fees apply). The prices above reflect the cost for current, valid USA Cycling Members (membership MUST be valid on race day). Visit USA Cycling for licensing fees & other questions.​
directions:
Schiff Scout Reservation is a 400-acre camp located in the Long Island Pine Barrens at 1606 Wading River Manor Road, Wading River, NY 11792. The camp surrounds a 30-acre deep pond, which is a kettle hole famous for its yellow perch, pickerel and sunfish. 

The Schiff Scout Reservation is a PRIVATE Boy Scout Camp and is NOT open to the general public. No trespassing is allowed. Please do not attempt to preview this course

title: 52nd Annual Kissena Labor Day Track Meet

address.street: Webster Park, Holt Road, Webster, NY

title: Syracuse Bicycle Breast Cancer Awareness Ride
description:
Syracuse Bicycle is hosting their 8th Annual Breast Cancer Awareness Ride on Saturday, October 1st, 2016 at Green Lakes State Park in Fayetteville, NY.  Participants can choose between three great ride options: a 10-mile family-friendly ride on the Erie Canal Path, a 25-mile or a 50-mile road ride on a scenic, flat loop north of Green Lakes State Park. Net proceeds from the event will benefit the tremendous efforts of the Carol M. Baldwin Breast Cancer Research Foundation of Central New York.  This means that money donated will stay local, helping more women and their families right here in CNY! All riders will receive a t-shirt, a chance to win fabulous door prizes, and fully catered post-ride lunch by Angotti’s Family Restaurant. On-course support provided by The Rabin Law Firm. Participating breast cancer survivors will receive a special gift, to be announced.

Why we ride…  We ride for our Mothers, Daughters, Sisters, Aunts, and our best friends. We ride for people we know and for people we don’t. We ride to raise money for research and to find a cure.  OUR GOAL: $25,000!
course:
10 mile ride on Erie Canal 
25 mile ride 
50 mile ride
Course maps available here http://syracusebicycle.com/events-3/breast-cancer-awareness-ride/
registration:
Registration available online here - http://www.active.com/fayetteville-ny/cycling/races/syracuse-bicycle-breast-cancer-awareness-ride-2016
In person registration on Friday September 30, 2016 at Syracuse Bicycle and Saturday, October 1, 2016 at Green Lakes State Park
directions: Green Lakes State Park is located at 7900 Green Lakes Dr. in Fayetteville, NY.

title: Plattekill Mtn Eastern States Cup DH Championship
Holimont Cyclocross Race
description: A day of cyclocross racing for all ages. Online pre-registration required at USAcycling.org.
course: Located entirely within the property of Holimont ski area, traversing the base of the ski hills on paved and dirt paths while crossing a wooden bridge and sand pit. There will be multiple dismounts on each lap with an off-camber traverse to the zig-zag area on the grass.
registration: If you have any difficulty registering online, please contact jrosen@jonrosensystems.com for assistance prior to race day. There will be limited time for race day registration and an additional fee will apply. Please help us start races on-time and provide accurate registration and results by registering online.
notes: Bicycle helmets are required for all races. Registration, timing and results produced by Jon Rosen Systems. Outdoor bike wash available.
directions: 6921 NY-242, Ellicottville, New York 14731. Ample free parking available in the main lot.

title: The Park School CX
description: A day of cyclocross racing for all ages. Online pre-registration required at USAcycling.org.
course: The course is located entirely within the property of The Park School of Buffalo, and features a closed road section, technical sections on grass and in the forest, off-camber turns, a gravel hill climb and a stair climb. Each lap is 1.3 miles with 80+ feet total elevation gain per lap.
registration: Online registration closes at 10pm EST on Saturday, October 22nd. If you have any difficulty registering online, please contact jrosen@jonrosensystems.com for assistance prior to race day. There will be limited time for race day registration and an additional fee will apply. Please help us start races on-time and provide accurate registration and results by registering online. Bib pickup on race day is inside the Rich Family Activity Center, and includes access to the lockers with hot showers available.
notes: Bicycle helmets are required for all races. Outdoor bike wash available.  Live results available on www.results.wnycx.com. Finish line photos for all races will be on the facebook.com event page for The Park School CX 2016.
directions: Located at 4625 Harlem Road in Amherst, New York between Main St. and Sheridan Drive, close to two exits on the I-290.

title: Long Island Cyclocross at Sunken Meadow
CRCA Roller Races
description:
It's back. Enjoy a evening of exciting roller racing action, benefiting the CRCA Junior Development Fund. 

Grab beer and food from The Cannibal at Gotham West Market, and watch spandex-clad racers on road bikes, track bikes, and Citi bikes, competing for the fastest time in the Club Room. A $20 cover for spectators will go directly to CRCA's Junior Team, helping them prepare for the 2017 racing season. 

Racers pay only $5 admission (limited spots - message Dan Schmalz if you'd like to compete) and you must hold a USAC license (one-day licenses will be available). Winners get cool prizes.
registration: Racers pay only $5 admission (limited spots - message Dan Schmalz if you'd like to compete) and you must hold a USAC license (one-day licenses will be available). Winners get cool prizes. A $20 cover for spectators will go directly to CRCA's Junior Team, helping them prepare for the 2017 racing season.
